Name: Isaiah Taylor
POS: Isaiah Taylor has been diagnosed with a retinal tear and will be sidelined for 1-2 weeks.

Name: D'Angelo Russell
POS: D'Angelo Russell underwent successful arthroscopic knee surgery on Friday to remove loose bodies.

Name: Jeremy Lin
POS: The Nets announced that Jeremy Lin had successful surgery Friday morning to repair the ruptured patella tendon in his right knee and will miss the rest of the season.

Name: Gordon Hayward
POS: Gordan Hayward (leg) has shed his hard cast and is now in a walking boot.

Name: Jeremy Lamb
POS: Jeremy Lamb (hamstring) will not return to Saturday's game against the Clippers.

Name: Julyan Stone
POS: Julyan Stone will miss the next 4-6 weeks with a Grade 2 left hamstring strain.

Name: David Nwaba
POS: David Nwaba (ankle) was unable to practice on Saturday and has been ruled out of Sunday's game vs. the Suns.

Name: Nikola Mirotic
POS: Nikola Mirotic (face) won't travel with the Bulls on their four-game road trip that begins on Sunday.

Name: Cameron Payne
POS: Cameron Payne (foot) is making progress and will be re-evaluated in three weeks.

Name: Zach LaVine
POS: Barring a setback, Zach LaVine (knee) will be cleared for full contact at Monday's practice.

Name: Iman Shumpert
POS: Iman Shumpert will be out for 5-7 days while he undergoes treatment and rehabilitation for a left knee effusion.

Name: Derrick Rose
POS: Derrick Rose (ankle) will miss at least the next two weeks.

Name: Tristan Thompson
POS: The Cavaliers announced on Thursday that Tristan Thompson will miss 3-4 weeks with a left calf strain.

Name: Isaiah Thomas
POS: Isaiah Thomas (hip) said he is "getting closer to being back on the floor and being able to play."

Name: Dorian Finney-Smith
POS: Rick Carlisle said that Dorian Finney-Smith (knee) "will be out a while."

Name: Seth Curry
POS: Seth Curry (leg) is listed as out for Friday's game vs. the Wolves.

Name: Josh McRoberts
POS: Josh McRoberts (lower extremity injury) is listed as out in the game notes for Wednesday's game vs. Memphis.

Name: Mason Plumlee
POS: Updating a previous item, Mason Plumlee (core strain) is probable to play against the Lakers on Sunday.

Name: Tyler Lydon
POS: Tyler Lydon is dealing with a sprained ankle.

Name: Jon Leuer
POS: Jon Leuer (ankle) is inactive for Friday against the Pacers.

Name: Kevin Durant
POS: Kevin Durant will sit out against the Nets on Sunday with a left ankle sprain.

Name: Glenn Robinson III
POS: Glenn Robinson III (ankle) had surgery and is expected to miss 3-4 months.

Name: Patrick Beverley
POS: Patrick Beverley (sore right knee) has been upgraded to questionable for Monday's matchup with the Knicks.

Name: Danilo Gallinari
POS: Danilo Gallinari (strained left glute) is listed as out for Saturday's game vs. the Hornets.

Name: Milos Teodosic
POS: Milos Teodosic (left foot) is in a walking boot.

Name: Larry Nance
POS: Larry Nance Jr. (hand) has been cleared to return to practice.

Name: Brandan Wright
POS: Brandan Wright (right groin) will not return on Saturday night.

Name: Ivan Rabb
POS: Ivan Rabb has been recalled from the G-League and will enter the NBA's concussion protocol.

Name: Wayne Selden
POS: Wayne Selden (right quad) will not play on Saturday vs. the Rockets.

Name: Mike Conley
POS: The Grizzlies have announced that Mike Conley (Achilles) will miss at least two more weeks.

Name: Okaro White
POS: Okaro White (foot) fractured the fifth metatarsal in his left foot during Tuesday's team practice and will undergo surgery on Thursday.

Name: A.J. Hammons
POS: The Heat have assigned A.J. Hammons to their G-League affiliate.

Name: Rodney McGruder
POS: Rodney McGruder underwent successful surgery on Tuesday to repair a stress fracture in his left tibia, and he's expected to begin rehab in one week.

Name: Cole Aldrich
POS: Cole Aldrich (ankle) will be available to play against the Spurs on Wednesday.

Name: Justin Patton
POS: Tom Thibodeau said Justin Patton (foot) is progressing as expected, but he will not rush the rehab process.

Name: Matthew Dellavedova
POS: Matthew Dellavedova (left knee tendinitis) will not play Saturday vs. the Mavs.

Name: Mirza Teletovic
POS: Mirza Teletovic (left knee soreness) will not play Saturday vs. Dallas.

Name: Jabari Parker
POS: Gery Woelfel of The Journal Times said Jabari Parker (knee) "already appears to be game ready."

Name: Anthony Davis
POS: Anthony Davis (face) is probable for Monday's game vs. the Thunder.

Name: Tony Allen
POS: Tony Allen (knee) is questionable to face the Thunder on Monday.

Name: Alexis Ajinca
POS: Alexis Ajinca underwent successful bilateral knee injections on Thursday and is expected to miss 4-6 weeks.

Name: Frank Jackson
POS: Frank Jackson (foot) underwent successful surgery on Friday to repair a fifth metatarsal fracture in his right foot.

POS: Solomon Hill (torn hamstring) could be back on the court as soon as February according to Pelicans GM Dell Demps.

Name: Omer Asik

POS: Ron Baker (shoulder) has been ruled out of Friday's game vs. Toronto.

POS: Adreian Payne suffered a fractured left hand in practice on Wednesday.

POS: Justin Anderson (shin splints) is expected to miss about three weeks.

POS: Jahlil Okafor (personal) has been ruled out of Saturday's game vs. the Warriors.

POS: Jared Dudley (knee) said he hopes to play in 1-2 weeks.

POS: Alan Williams (knee surgery) said he just started light walking for the first time in four weeks.

POS: The Suns announced on Friday that Davon Reed underwent a meniscus repair of his left knee that will sideline him for approximately four to six months.

POS: Brandon Knight underwent surgery to repair a torn ACL in his left knee on Friday and will miss the entire 2017-18 season.

Name: Al-Farouq Aminu
POS: Al-Farouq Aminu (ankle) remains out for Friday's game against the Kings.

Name: Wade Baldwin
POS: Wade Baldwin underwent successful surgery to repair an ulnar collateral ligament tear in his right thumb.

POS: C.J. Wilcox underwent a successful arthroscopy on his right knee on Monday and is expected to miss 6-8 weeks.

Name: Derrick White
POS: Derrick White suffered a right wrist fracture in the G-League.

POS: Vince Carter (illness) will not play Saturday vs. the Blazers.

POS: Harry Giles (knee) will be held out until at least January.

POS: Serge Ibaka (swollen left knee) will play on Sunday vs. the Wizards.

POS: Rudy Gobert is reportedly expected to miss the next 4-6 weeks of action with a bone bruise in his right knee.

POS: Dante Exum underwent a successful procedure Tuesday morning to stabilize the AC joint in his left shoulder.
